article.headline: Wofford 62, The Citadel 55
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Noah Dahlman scored 17 points to lead Wofford to a 60-55 win over The Citadel on Saturday night, sweeping the season series. Dahlman, who was the only Wofford player to score in double figures, finished with seven rebounds for the Terriers (15-13, 11-8 Southern Conference). Tim Johnson also grabbed eight rebounds and Junior Salters had six. The Terriers have won four of their last five games. Demetrius Nelson paced the Bulldogs (19-11, 14-5) with 14 points and eight rebounds, and was the only player to score in double figures for The Citadel. The score was tied 25-25 at halftime, but the Terriers outscored the Bulldogs 35-30 in the second half. Wofford went 6-for-17 from beyond the arc, while The Citadel hit just 3-of-15 shots from long range. The Terriers also hit 11-of-13 free throws compared to the Bulldogs, who hit 10 of 16.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
